alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 330 PM EDT... At 227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Madawaska to 6 miles southwest of Fort Kent. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, New Canada, Lille, Cross Lake, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Sinclair, Daigle, Soldier Pond, Saint Agatha and Saint John. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
